details.name: transforming_markers
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/data/transforming_markers.py example shows a scatter plot of the Palmer penuguins dataset, color- and marker-mapped by species. The x-axis is flipper length (mm) and the y-axis is body mass (g).

details.name: latex_blackbody_radiation
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/latex_blackbody_radiation.py example shows plot of spectral radiance curves for an ideal radiating blackbody at various temperatures with mathtext axis labels.

details.name: latex_normal_distribution
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/latex_normal_distribution.py example shows a plot of the sampled and ideal Gaussian distribution with mathtext axis tick labels.

details.name: network_graph
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/network_graph.py example shows a network graph plot of the NetworkX karate club dataset with large circles for vertices.

details.name: hexbin
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/hexbin.py example shows a hexbin plot of 2d random (Gaussian) data points, colormapped by density with the Viridis palette.

details.name: sprint
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/sprint.py example shows a scatter plot comparing historical Olympic sprint times to the 2012 record set by Usain Bolt. The x-axis marks time behind the record and the y-axis marks olympic years.

details.name: ridgeplot
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/ridgeplot.py example shows a ridgeline plot using the Perceptions of Probability dataset with a smoothed distribution displayed for each probability category on the y-axis.

details.name: hex_tile
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/hex_tile.py example shows a hex tile plot of binned 2d random (Gaussian) data points, colormapped by density with the Viridis palette.

details.name: bar_colormapped
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/bars/colormapped.py example shows a simple bar plot with bars for six categories of fruit on the x-axis, and bars shaded with the Bright6 palette.

details.name: bar_intervals
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/bars/intervals.py example shows an interval chart showing Olympic sprint time data as intervals using blue horizontal bars for times, with a bar for earch year on the y-axis.

details.name: range_tool
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/range_tool.py example shows a column of two plots of timeseries plots of stock price data. The bottom plot shows all the data and has a range tool for controlling the viewport of the top plot.

details.name: pie_chart
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/pie.py example shows a pie chart of random data with a legend.

details.name: bar_mixed
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/bars/mixed.py example shows a bar chart of synthetic monthly sales data, grouped by quarter. A line showing each quarterly average is overlaid.

details.name: bar_nested_colormapped
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/bars/nested_colormapped.py example shows a grouped bar chart on a hierachical categorical axis of years for different categories of fruit. Each group has a silver, blue, and red bar corresponding to random values for years 2015, 2016 and 2017.

details.name: categorical_heatmap
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/categorical_heatmap.py example shows a 3x3 categorical heatmap of random data.

details.name: schrodinger
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/schrodinger.py example shows solutions of Schrödinger’s equation for the motion of a particle in one dimension in a parabolic potential well for eight energy levels, with mathtext labels for each solution.

details.name: bar_pandas_groupby_colormapped
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/bars/pandas_groupby_colormapped.py example shows a bar chart of MPG vs cylinders using the Auto MPG dataset, colormapped by the number of cylinders.

details.name: bar_pandas_groupby_nested
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/bars/pandas_groupby_nested.py example shows a grouped bar chart of MPG vs cylinders and manufacturer, using the Auto MPG dataset. The bars are grouped and colormapped by the number of cylinders.

details.name: bar_stacked
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/bars/stacked.py example shows a stacked bar chart for random data for six categories of fruit. Each row in the stack corresponds to a different year.

details.name: bar_stacked_split
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/bars/stacked_split.py example.

details.name: categorical_scatter_jitter
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/categorical_scatter_jitter.py example shows a categorical scatter plot of several years of GitHub commits. The y-axis is day of the week and the x-axis is time of day, with scater points jittered to avoid overlap

details.name: bar_nested
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/bars/nested.py example shows a grouped bar chart on a hierachical categorical axis of years for different categories of fruit. Each group has three blue bars corresponding to random values for years 2015, 2016 and 2017.

details.name: candlestick
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/candlestick.py example shows a candlestick plot of historical Microsoft stock prices.

details.name: legend
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/legend.py example shows a row of two plots that have sine waves in different scatter and line styles, illustrated in accompanying legends.

details.name: bar_colors
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/bars/colors.py example shows a simple bar chart of six bars shaded according to the Bright6 palette.

details.name: box_annotation
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/box_annotation.py example shows a timeseries plot of glucose data readings with red box annotations marking regions where the readings are too high or too low.

details.name: les_mis
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/les_mis.py example shows a reproduction of D3’s Les Misérables Co-occurrence chart that illustrates which characters were in scenes together with a shaded square in the matrix plot.

details.name: bar_dodged
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/bars/dodged.py example shows a grouped bar chart using a visual dodge on the bars, rather than a hierarchical axis. Each group has a silver, blue, and red bar illustrated in the accompanying legend.

details.name: unemployment
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/unemployment.py example shows a categorical heatmap of monthly US unemployment data from 1948 to 2016. The x-axis is years and the y-axis is month of the year.

details.name: stocks
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/stocks.py example shows a scatter plot of stock close prices with a line showing average prices. Shaded grid bands are underneath.

details.name: hatch_grid_band
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/styling/hatch_grid_band.py example shows a sine wave with hatched grid bands underneath.

details.name: image_rgba
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/image_rgba.py example shows an image plot of synthetic RGBA data.

details.name: dotplot
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/dotplot.py example shows a dot plot of synthetic data for eight categories.

details.name: periodic
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/periodic.py example shows a plot that renders the periodic table of elements.

details.name: histogram
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/histogram.py example shows a gridplot of four plots. Each plot has a histogram of sampled data from a statistical distribution overlaid with a line showing the ideal distribution curve.

details.name: image
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/image.py example shows a plot with a colormapped two-dimensonal sine surface.

details.name: slider
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/slider.py example shows a layout with a sine plot on the left and sliders on the right to control the sine wave properties such as frequency and phase.

details.name: jitter
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/jitter.py example shows a column of two categorical scatter plots of random data. The top has no jitter applied, may scatter points overlap. The bottom has jitter applied to distinguish points better.

details.name: lorenz
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/lorenz.py example shows a plot of the Lorenz attractor using the MultiLine glyph.

details.name: color_scatter
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/color_scatter.py example shows a multicolored scatter plot of random data with hover tool.

details.name: color_sliders
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/color_sliders.py example shows a layout with RGB sliders on the left to control a plot on the right. A colorbar with hover tool is underneath.

details.name: iris_splom
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/iris_splom.py example shows a SPLOM gridplot of the Iris data set for all dimensions.

details.name: anscombe
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/anscombe.py example shows a gridplot of four scatter and regression line plots illustrating Anscombe's Quartet.

details.name: texas
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/texas.py example shows a color-mapped map plot based on Texas unemployment rate per county, colormapped using the Viridis palette.

details.name: markers
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/markers.py example shows all the different scatter marker types available in Bokeh on a single plot.

details.name: burtin
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/burtin.py example shows a reproduction of Burtin's hitorical antibiotics plot.

details.name: bar_basic
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/bars/basic.py example shows a simple bar chart for counts for categories of fruits.

details.name: stacked_area
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/stacked_area.py example shows a stacked area plot of synthetic data for ten series, colormapped using the Sunset palette, with a legend at the top.

details.name: elements
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/elements.py example shows a scatter plot of density vs atomic weight of atomic elements, colormapped by their melting points.

details.name: boxplot
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/boxplot.py example shows a box plot of synthetic data for six categories.

details.name: logplot
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/logplot.py example shows a plot of six basic mathematical functions such as y=x and y=x**2 on a log-scale using different lines styles for each.

details.name: eclipse
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/eclipse.py example shows a plot of US states overlaid with a trajectory marking the path of the August 2017 solar eclipse.

details.name: bessel
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/bessel.py example shows a plot with the first four Bessel function J_0 to J_3 with mathtext labels and a mathtext title.

details.name: contour
details.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/specialized/contour.py example shows an iso-contour plot with ten levels between -2 and 2.
